result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby Michael Shaffer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bobby Michael Shaffer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bobby Michael Shaffer was found guilty of Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Bobby Michael Shaffer was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: If the defendant is not admitted to either the Extended Foster Care Program or the Post Educational Services & Support Program, the defendant shall maintain full time employment or work full time or a combination of work and school that equals 40 hours per week.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with the victim T. R. (DOB 11/17/1999), her mother Monica Ferguson or the property located at 106 N. Broad Street, Argyle, WI. 53504.
Defendant shall not have any electronic or telephone communication with the victim in the case.

A Probation Review Hearing shall be held on August 24, 2016 and at any other time ordered by the court until the interstate compact is in place.
Defendant shall obtain his GED by December 31, 2016.
Defendant shall seek admission to the Extended Foster Care Program in the State of Florida and follow all rules of that program.
Defendant shall reside in Tampa, Florida, or any other location in the Sate of Florida where he is placed by the Extended Foster Care Program.
Defendant shall seek admission to the Post Educational Services & Support Program in the State of Florida and follow all rules in that program.
Defendant shall cooperate with the Independant Living Program of Hillsborough County, Florida, including meeting with any case workers and following program rules.
Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superTimeConds.notes:
Defendant shall serve conditional time in jail until an interstate compact is in place and arrangements have been made for the defendant to return to the State of Florida.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

The court grants the request

Defendant Bobby Michael Shaffer in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Defendant Bobby Michael Shaffer in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court denies any modification at this time.  Probation review hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:20 AM.
Defendant Bobby Michael Shaffer in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Defendant Bobby Michael Shaffer in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bucher informs the court this matter is resolved, and files plea and waiver form with the court .
Court questions counsel re: Rule #2 Defendant shall remain in custody until Interstate compact agreement is put into place and arrangements have been made for the defendant to return to the state of Florida.
Counsel informs the court re: this agreement (60 days for review hearing).
The court requests for additional time to review the interstate compact agreement.
>>Counsel stipulates to a determinate amount of time (60 days or until such time as an interstate compact is put into place and that way there is at least a determinate amount of time in the agreement).
Defendant withdrawals his plea of "NOT GUILTY" to "NO CONTEST" on Counts 3 & 4 in the information.
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights, court also questions attorney Bucher re: her clients plea and waiver of rights.
State waives jury trial in this matter.
Counsel stipulates that there is  factual basis stated in the criminal complaint.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily & intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to Counts 3 & 4.
Attorney Bucher moves for Expungement Eligibility on the Class I Felony (upon completion of the agreement ).***GRANTED***
Dismissing  Counts 1 & 2.
State moves for joint plea agreement of the parties.
Attorney Bucher makes statement on behalf of her client, and moves the court to adopt the plea agreement.
Court grants motion of the parties withholds sentence and orders the defendant be placed on probation for a period of 4 years with conditions.
>See agreement for complete list of probation conditions.
>120 Day's conditional  jail time or until the Interstate Compact is put into place without a court date (which ever comes first).
>No contact with T. R. (DOB 11/17/1999),  with Monica Ferguson or the property located at 206 Broad Street, Argyle, WI. 53541.
>No electronic or telephone communication with the victim in this matter.
>>>Count 3 (8 years)
3 Years Initial Confinment
5 Years Extended Supervision
>>>Count 4 Sentence Withheld Probation Ordered.
